case_vignette: A 28-year-old man who works as a resident in general surgery presents feeling "burned out" for the last 2 months. He says he has been working extremely long hours under stressful conditions, which makes him irritable, edgy, unfocused, and forgetful. He says he also has severe anxiety about how these symptoms are affecting his performance at work, making it difficult for him to sleep even when he has time off. The patient is referred for counseling and is prescribed some mild sleep aids. At follow-up a few months later, he says he is feeling much improved due to improved staffing at the hospital and a more manageable workload.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling really burned out, irritable, on edge, unfocused, and forgetful lately.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For the last 2 months.
Have you been feeling tired all the time and having trouble sleeping?
Yes, I've been having trouble sleeping, especially when I have time off.
Do you have a history of depression or anxiety?
I've been having severe anxiety about my performance at work.
Have you had any major life changes or stressful events recently?
I've been working extremely long hours under stressful conditions.
Thank you for the information. Do you currently take any medications or have any medical conditions that could contribute to your symptoms?
I was prescribed some mild sleep aids.
Do you have a family history of mood disorders or anxiety?
I don't know, I'm just a patient describing my symptoms without medical knowledge.

Understood. Thank you for sharing your information. Based on your symptoms, medical history, and circumstances, it seems like you may be experiencing symptoms of **major depressive disorder (MDD)**. This can be exacerbated by your high-stress work environment and lack of sleep. I recommend seeking professional help for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan.
